chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Pieter E Bruner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

--No possession or conumption of alcohol beverages 

--No posseesion or consumption any illegal drugs

--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent

--To try to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand


Arresting Agency:  Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Restitution in owing to be converted to civil judgment.

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 5% restitution surcharge

--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, to commence FORTHWITH--the authorizes Huber privileges, but it is not to begin until 5/10/17.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV:

[MA]Case called at 11:16am 
Defendant Pieter E Bruner in court, in custody with attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel verify receipt of revocation order and warrant packet
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Bruner

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, to commence FORTHWITH--the authorizes Huber privileges, but it is not to begin until 5/10/17.
--60 days credit for time already served given

The Court orders: 
Outstanding Court costs to be paid in 90 days
Attorney fees to be repaid at the rate of $50 per month beginning until 9/1/2017
Restitution in owing to be converted to civil judgment.

Cases 15CF266, 15CT416 & 15TR6550 called together at 10:12 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Pieter E Bruner in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF266: 
State files AMENDED information; Service of Information Admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15TR6550
DA Beck submits victim impact statement

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment (within 60 days of disposition) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Mental health assessment due to head injury
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To try to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $2668.52 payable to Thomas Showers
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To pay statutory costs of $243
--No contact with Thomas Showers
--No possession or conumption of alcohol beverages 
--No posseesion or consumption any illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No presence at the NAPA auto parts store in Jefferson, WI
--DNA Sample NOT ordered
--To pay DNA Surcharge
Days credit for time already served: 1 day

15CT416: Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $484.50; due in $100 incriments per month, beginning 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
To submit a DNA Sample

3 demerit points assessed
No driver license revocation
Recess: 10:37 am

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] Cases #15CF266, #15CT416 and #15TR6550 called at 11:04am. 
Defendant Pieter E Bruner in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case #15CF266:  
--Attorney Lippert requests that the case be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing. 

As to Case #15CT416:
--Attorney Lippert clarifies that his appearance today is a special appearance; he has not been appointed by the Public Defender in this case. Mr. Bruner understands that he will need to apply for PD representation in this case.
--Service of the Complaint admitted; reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
--The Court enters a plea of "Not Guilty" on Mr. Bruner's behalf.  The Defense waives speedy trial.
--The Court indicates that the Bond in Case #15CF266 also will be applied to this case. 

As to Case #15TR6550: 
-- The Court enters a plea of "Not Guilty" on Mr. Bruner's behalf.  The Defense waives speedy trial.
recess 11:07am. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing in Case #15CF266 on 10/9/15 at 8:30am;  Cases #15CT416 and #15TR6550 are to track and be set for Status Conference on same date and time
Original Bond Document recieved from JESO on 8/20/15

case called at 1:37-pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Pieter E Bruner appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Bruner is eligible for PD representation. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Tom Showers 
--No presence at NAPA Auto Parts in Jefferson
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances 

The Court confirms with Mr. Bruner that the eye and hair color on the Criminal Complaint are inverted. Mr. Bruner states that his hair is brown and his eyes are green.
recess 1:39 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/2/15 at 9:20am   (2) Status Conference on 9/25/15 at 10:30am
Print Screen from DA's Office advising that the defendant's hair color is Brown and eye color is Green
